problem.p: A car starts from rest and accelerates up to 30 mph. After a minute, the car (at 30 mph) accelerates again up to 60 mph. What can you say about the work done by the engine to perform these increases in speed?

optionresponse.p: the 0-30 mph increase required more work than the 30-60 mph increase
the 30-60 mph increase required less work than the 0-30 mph increase
the 0-30 mph increase required less work than the 30-60 mph increase
the 30-60 mph increase required more work than the 0-30 mph increase
both increases in speed required zero work
the 0-30 mph increase required the same amount of work as the 30-60 mph increase
the 30-60 mph increase required the same amount of work as the 0-30 mph increase
cannot tell -- need to know the time interval of each acceleration
